page.title: 09FARMING IN OUR AREA
page.content: IN 1985 FARMING IS A MAIN FEATURE IN THE AREA.ALTOGETHER THERE ARE 11 FARMS RANGING IN SIZE FROM 40 ACRCS TO 1753 ACRES.ALL THE FARMS ARE MIXED.THE MAIN CROPS THEY GROW ARE BARLEY AND TURNIPS.THE MAIN ANIMALS ARE CATTLE AND SHEEP. THE MAIN BREEDS OF SHEEP ARE SUFFOLKS.THE MAIN BREEDS OF CATTLE ARE HEREFORDS AND CHAROLAIS.THE MOST COMMOM MACHINERY IS TRACTORS,COMBINES, BAILERS,TRAILERS,ROLLERS AND SPREADERS. THE FARMERS REPAIR THEIR{MACHINERY} EITHER BY THEMSELVES OR AT LOCAL DEALERS. THE NEAREST ARE IN ST.BOSWELLS.FARMERS USE MORE MACHINES THAN BEFORE AND SO EMPLOY LESS PEOPLE. MOST FARMS EMPLOY LESS THAN FIVE PEOPLE. THEY SELL THEIR CROPS TO SEED MERCHANTS.THE CATTLE MARKET IS IN ST.BOSWELLS.
